sentences.en: A cautionary note: The body possesses exquisite systems which accurately regulate body sodium.
sentences.cn: 谨记: 人体拥有精确调整体钠的精密系统.

sentences.en: a cautionary tale about the problems of buying a computer
sentences.cn: 有关购买计算机时可能遇到种种问题的告诫

sentences.en: As the British pound continues to sink, its travails a cautionary tale for the U.S. dollar.
sentences.cn: 着英镑继续下滑, 其经历的阵痛对美元应该是个警示.

sentences.en: Barely fifteen months later, it has become a cautionary tale of the pitfalls of international mergers and acquisitions.
sentences.cn: 不过15个月，它就成了告诫人们留心跨国并购中陷阱的警世故事。

sentences.en: But there were also cautionary signals in the Hynson opinion.
sentences.cn: 可是在"海森"案的意见里,还有一些告诫性的信号.

sentences.en: But what was intended a cautionary tale was taken by some readers as blaming the victims.
sentences.cn: 不过,这个意在警世的故事,一些读者解读为作者怪罪受害者.

sentences.en: Smith complained of pain in his Back and was taken to hospital for pre - cautionary X - rays.
sentences.cn: 史密斯由于背部疼痛被送到医院接受 X 光检查.

sentences.en: That was a cautionary tale for disobedient children.
sentences.cn: 那只是吓唬不听话的小孩子们的故事罢了.

sentences.en: The 1937 episode provides a cautionary tale.
sentences.cn: 1937年发生的事情给我们敲了警钟.

sentences.en: What other cautionary labels would be useful?
sentences.cn: 到底怎么才能是有用的警示标志 呢 ?

trans.tran_cn: 警告的，提醒注意的，告诫的，<英>担保的
trans.tran_en: giving a warning about what not to do
